# Still so many observations. Start with looking at just one situation (PowerPlay) 

# The more shots, the better chance of scoring on the powerplay...right? Let's see if that theory checks out. 
```{r}
library(tidyverse) 

Smallest_Powerplay_df <- PP_power_play_small


 PP_shots <- PP_power_play_small %>%
  select(opposingTeam, shotAttemptsFor, shotsOnGoalFor, goalsFor) %>%
   mutate(propShotsThrough = shotsOnGoalFor / shotAttemptsFor) 

```


```{r}
#shotsThrough_sub <- PP_shots %>% 
  #filter(opposingTeam == "WSH")

ggplot(PP_shots, aes(x = propShotsThrough, y = goalsFor)) +
  geom_dotplot()
```


```{r}
var_choices <- names(type_of_goal)[2:4]

library(shiny)

ui <- fluidPage(sidebarLayout(sidebarPanel(
    selectizeInput("gamechoice",
    label = "Choose an Opponent", choices = levels(factor(type_of_goal$opposingTeam)),
    selected = "STL")),
    radioButtons("varchoice", label = "Choose a Category",
                 choices = var_choices),
                mainPanel(plotOutput("histograph"))
                )
  
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {
  
  small_type_sub <- reactive({
    type_of_goal %>% filter(opposingTeam == input$gamechoice)
  })
  
  hist_plot <- reactive({
    ggplot(small_type_sub(), aes(x = .data[[input$varchoice]])) +
      geom_histogram(colour = "black", fill = "white")
  })
  
  output$histgraph <- renderPlot({
    hist_plot()
  })
}

shinyApp(ui, server)
```
